meanings.definition: A constitutional predisposition or tendency, as to a particular disease or other abnormal state of the body.
meanings.sent1: His family's diathesis towards heart conditions meant he had to be extra careful with his diet.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that her diathesis made her more susceptible to allergies.
meanings.sent3: Despite his diathesis for colds, he always found humor in his constant sneezing fits.
meanings.sent4: Her diathesis for drama seemed to attract chaotic situations like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The diathesis for diabetes in their genes was a constant reminder to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

meanings.definition: A condition of the body that makes it easier for you to get a particular disease.
meanings.sent1: Due to his diathesis, he caught the flu every winter without fail.
meanings.sent2: The diathesis towards skin conditions meant she had to be diligent with her skincare routine.
meanings.sent3: His diathesis for stomach bugs made him the unofficial champion of sick days at work.
meanings.sent4: The diathesis for infections in her system felt like a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: Living with a diathesis for migraines was a daily battle against pain and discomfort.
